Package cosc202.andie

Class LanguageActions

java.lang.Object
cosc202.andie.LanguageActions
public class LanguageActions extends Object
A class that manages the language of the UI compoenents in a JFrame. The LanguageActions class enables multilanguage capabilities to the Andie User-Interface.

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Constructor
    Description
    LanguageActions(JFrame frame)
    Constructs a LanguageActions object with reference to a JFrame.

  • Constructor Details

    • LanguageActions

      public LanguageActions(JFrame frame)
      Constructs a LanguageActions object with reference to a JFrame. Initializes the supported languages.
      Parameters:
      frame - The JFrame containing the UI components.

  • Method Details

    • createMenu

      public JMenu createMenu()
      Creates a JMenu for language selection.
      Returns:
      JMenu containing the supported language options.

    • changeLanguage

      public void changeLanguage(Locale locale)
      Changes the application's language based on teh specified Locale. Updates all UI components' text and repaints the Jframe.
      Parameters:
      locale - the Locale object representing the new language.

    • updateComponentTexts

      public void updateComponentTexts(Component component, Locale locale)
      Recursively updates the text of UI components based on the specified Locale. Handles various UI component types, JMenu, JLabel, JMenuItem and JButton.
      Parameters:
      component - The root component to start updating from.
      locale - The Locale object representing the new language.

    • getLocalizedText

      public String getLocalizedText(String key, Locale locale)
      Retrieves the localized text for the paticular key based on specified Locale. The method uses a ResourceBundle to look up the appropriate translation for the text. If the key is not found, it returns a default text and logs an error message.
      Parameters:
      key - The key is associated with the required text within the ResourceBundle.
      locale - The Locale object which represents the required language.
      Returns:
      The localized text for the specific key and Locale or default text if the key is not found.
